title: Patterns and Sorting

vocab.definition: Things that repeat in the same order again and again
To put things into groups that are the same in some way
Things that are alike or equal
To do something again in the same way

teachingNotes: Use colored blocks, beads, or shapes for pattern activities. Practice AB, ABB, ABC patterns. Sort by color, size, shape.

sample.question: What comes next in this pattern: red, blue, red, blue, ____?
Sort these shapes: circle, square, circle, triangle, square.
Make an ABC pattern with sounds.
expectedAny: clap, stomp, snap, clap, stomp, snap

sample.question: Continue this pattern: big, small, big, small, ____
How would you sort colored blocks?

truefalse.question: In the pattern circle, square, circle, square, the next shape is circle.
You can sort things by color.
expectedAny: color is one way to sort

truefalse.question: Big and small can be used for sorting.
ABC patterns have three different parts.
You can only sort by one thing at a time.
Patterns help us predict what comes next.

multiplechoice.question: How should you sort these toys: big truck, small car, big ball, small block?
expectedAny: these toys can be sorted by big and small

multiplechoice.question: How many groups would you make sorting: red car, blue car, red block, blue block?
expectedAny: 2 groups: red things and blue things

multiplechoice.question: What type of pattern is: A, B, B, A, B, B?
Which doesn't belong: circle, square, triangle, red?
expectedAny: red is a color, others are shapes

multiplechoice.question: What continues: clap, clap, stomp, clap, clap, ____?

fillintheblank.question: In an AB pattern, if A is clap and B is stomp, the pattern goes: clap, _____, clap, stomp.
To sort by size, put all the _____ things together.
If the pattern is triangle, circle, triangle, the next shape is _____.
When sorting animals, dogs go with _____ and cats go with _____.
An ABC pattern has _____ different parts that repeat.
The pattern red, blue, green, red, blue, _____ continues.
Things that are the _____ can be grouped together.

shortanswer.question: Make a pattern using two colors. What would your pattern be?
How would you sort a box of different buttons?
Create an ABB pattern using body movements.
expectedAny: clap, stomp, stomp, clap, stomp, stomp

shortanswer.question: What's the difference between AB and ABC patterns?
Name three ways you could sort toy cars.
Explain what makes something a pattern.

wordProblems.question: You have 6 blocks. You put 4 blocks in the red group and 2 blocks in the blue group. Did you sort all your blocks?
Sara makes a necklace with this pattern: red bead, blue bead, red bead, blue bead. If she continues the pattern, what color is the 5th bead?
In art class, there are 6 red crayons, 4 blue crayons, and 2 yellow crayons. How many groups would you make if sorting by color?
Tom's pattern is: stomp, clap, stomp, clap. If he does this 4 times, how many stomps will he do?
The class sorts 12 blocks. 5 are big and 7 are small. Which group has more blocks?
Emma makes an ABC pattern with shapes. She uses circle, square, triangle. What are the first 6 shapes in her pattern?
expectedAny: circle, square, triangle, circle, square, triangle

wordProblems.question: In the toy box, there are 3 toy cars, 3 toy trucks, and 3 toy planes. If we sort by type, how many toys are in each group?
